alert.note: Alert for Christian; Daviess; Henderson; Hopkins; McLean; Muhlenberg; Todd; Trigg; Webster (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 6:36AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Spencer, Daviess, southeastern Henderson, Muhlenberg, Christian, McLean, southeastern Trigg, Todd, eastern Hopkins and northeastern Webster Counties through 615 AM CDT... At 536 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Robards to 7 miles east of Madisonville to near Crofton to 7 miles northwest of Big Rock. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sebree, Robards and Beech Grove around 540 AM CDT. St. Joseph around 545 AM CDT. Livermore around 550 AM CDT. Stanley around 555 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Owensboro, Weir, Hopkinsville, Rockport, Pembroke, Powderly, Greenville, Grandview, Knottsville, Dunmor and Elkton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 65 and 92. Interstate 165 between Mile Markers 60 and 70. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 103 and 111, and between Mile Markers 121 and 144. Western Kentucky Parkway between Mile Markers 39 and 65. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 1 and 34. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 7 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Christian; Daviess; Henderson; Hopkins; McLean; Muhlenberg; Todd; Trigg; Webster
